unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Sampling Distribution for Slope
question_text: A senior at a large high school is finishing up his AP Statistics class and has begun his study of linear regression for slope. Similar to other sampling distributions he has already studied, what characteristics of the sampling distribution should the student not worry about during his study of linear regression for slope?
solution:
Whenever an AP Statistics student is looking at a sampling distribution, there are three main characteristics that the learner should focus on:

Shape : Approximately Normal

Center : Mean of the Sampling Distribution

Spread : Standard Deviation of the Sampling Distribution

Knowing these three characteristics will allow the learned to find probability within the sampling distribution, as well as begin the process of inference whether it's confidence intervals or significance testing.

Therefore, the only characteristic that is not necessary for this student would be correlation .

Choice 'C' is correct.
